author: Moscadini
title: Shuttle Test Run
review:
Perfect for your Space Port collection.  You got the Zero-G practice chair, you got your flight simulator 'plane' and you got your Space Shuttle...so only thing that is left is your High Altitude plane just like any astronaut needs before they head into space.

Pros:
Small
Simple
Awesome astronaut
Awesome windshield

Con:
(Only 1), could have given it am oxygen pack back though

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town (Space Port) - Space Port Jet Review
review:
This is a great set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 16 pages and there're no mistakes in it as well.

Parts

This set has 66 pieces. I don't know how much this model was when it was on sale but I think it's worth the money for sure.

Minifigures

The astronaut has a white overall, a white helmet, a golden visor and a headset on his face. It's a good figure to have as well.

The build

The build is very fun and easy and we also get some stickers to put on.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6465-1.jpg[/img]


This set may doesn't do much but it's still very easy to maneuver it. It also looks very fast. The only play feature we get is that you can open the top of the engine on the back. As I told you in the beginning: This is a great set to have.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
